member.summary: Clears the list.

member.summary: Returns a type specific enumerator.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the collection.

member.returns: Boolean, true if the remove operation is successful.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the enumerator.
member.returns: The enumerator.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.Exclude(`0)
member.summary: Exclude should be called AFTER the item is successfully removed from the list. This allows any handlers that connect to the item to be removed in the event that the item is no longer anywhere in the list.
member.param: The item to be removed

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.Include(`0)
member.summary: Includes the specified item. This should be called BEFORE an item is added to the list.
member.param: Item to be included.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnClear
member.summary: Clears this collection.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnExclude(`0)
member.summary: Occurs any time an item is removed from the collection and no longer exists anywhere in the collection
member.param: Item that gets excluded.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnInclude(`0)
member.summary: Occurs any time an item is added or inserted into the collection and did not previously exist in the collection
member.param: Item that gets included.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnIncludeComplete(`0)
member.summary: Occurs after the item has been included either by set, insert, or addition.
member.param: Item that was included.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnInnerListSet
member.summary: After serialization, the inner list is directly set. This is uzed by the FeatureLayer, for instance, to apply the new scheme.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnInsert(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Occurs when items are inserted.
member.param: Index where the item should be inserted.
Item that should be inserted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnInsertComplete(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Occurs after a new item has been inserted, and fires IncludeComplete
member.param: Index where the item should be inserted.
Item that should be inserted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnMoved(`0,System.Int32)
member.summary: Occurs whenever a layer is moved.
member.param: Layer that is moved.
Position the layer is moved to.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnRemoveComplete(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Fires after the remove operation, ensuring that OnExclude gets called
member.param: Index where the item should be removed.
Item that should be removed.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnSet(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Fires before the set operation ensuring the new item is included if necessary.
member.param: The index.
The old value.
The new value.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.BaseCollection`1.OnSetComplete(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Fires after the set operation, ensuring that the item is removed
member.param: The index.
The old value.
The new value.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Serialization.MovedTypes
member.summary: This contains a list of types that were moved from one assembly to another when DotSpatial.Topology was replaced by NetTopologySuite/GeoAPI. This is used to make sure that the old dspx files that contain types from DotSpatial.Topology can be loaded using NetTopologySuite.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets a list of all types that were moved when DotSpatial.Topology was replaced by NetTopologySuite/GeoAPI.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeExtent
member.summary: Extent works like an envelope but is faster acting, has a minimum memory profile, only works in 2D and has no events.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This introduces no error checking and assumes that the user knows what they are doing when working with this.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName
member.summary: A class for parsing the components of the assembly qualified type name.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Reads in the full string, parsing out the separate elements. These are not always in the specified order, and many times there are several optional elements. This class helps find the optional elements that are necessary. This does not support mulitple enclosed types yet, like dictionaries or something. We needed the single enclosed type for supporting the layer collection however.
member.param: The string qualified name.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName.Assembly
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the assembly

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName.Culture
member.summary: Gets or sets the CultureInfo of the Culture

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName.EnclosedName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name for the enclosed type.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName.PublicKeyToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the public key token for the strong name of the assembly.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName.TypeName
member.summary: Gets or sets the TypeName

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Version for getting or setting the version.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.QualifiedTypeName.ToString
member.summary: Returns the full qualified type name as "TypeName, Assembly, Version=x, Culture=x, PublicKeyToken=x".
member.returns: The string expression with the full type name.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute
member.summary: This class contains details on how to serialize a field or property.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name to use when serializing the associated member.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.UseCases
member.summary: UseCases contains all the cases in which a constructor property can be used.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.UseCases.ConstructorOnly
member.summary: Use the property only as an argument of the constructor.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.UseCases.StaticMethodOnly
member.summary: Use the property only as an argument of the static method.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.UseCases.Both
member.summary: Use the property as an argument for the constructor as well as for the static method.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets the name to use when serializing the associated member.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.ConstructorArgumentIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the constructor argument index that the associated member represents. The default value is -1, which indicates that the associated member is not used as a constructor argument. If this value is larger than 0 and no UseCase is set ConstructorOnly is automatically assumed for backwards compatibility.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.Formatter
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the formatter to use for the associated value. The type must be derived from .

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.StaticConstructorMethodName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the static method that can be used to construct a new instance in case of classes that are not able to construct a working version of themselves in the constructor. This should be attached to a boolean property that also indicates whether the static constructor should be used via IndicatesStaticConstructor.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.UseStaticConstructor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the static method should be used to construct the instance. This may only be used on a single boolean property. Also add the StaticConstructorMethodName to the same boolean property.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Serialization.SerializeAttribute.UseCase
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the argument can be used as constructor argument for the static method only, the constructor only, in both cases or not at all. The None case should only be set if ConstructorArgumentIndex is -1.

Name of the Api that should be replaced.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Serialization.TypeNameManager
member.summary: In many cases, the explicit type name references a version or public key token that is expired, even though the reference is still perfectly valid in the new instance. This type allows testing for that eventuality, as well as working directly with the components of a fully qualified name.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.TypeNameManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.TypeNameManager.UpdateTypename(System.String)
member.summary: Since the version, or even possibly the strong name may be dynamic, an older reference may need to be updated with local assembly information.
member.param: The invalidated type name, usually because the version is out of date.
member.returns: A string representing the same type, but with a modern assembly.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.TypeNameManager.UpdateAssembly(System.String)
member.summary: This method searches the executable path, as well as sub-folders looking for an instance of the specified assembly. Since this class is only needed if the fully qualified assembly name is invalid, we have to assume that we are looking for something else.
member.param: The string assembly name.

member.summary: Deserializes the given XML, writing the values into the given object.

member.summary: Gets the constructor arguments of the element.
member.param: The element whose constructor arguments should be returned.
If a constructor argument contained a name of a static method that should be used for instance construction this will be returned here.
member.returns: A list of the constructor arguments that were found.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Serialization.XmlHelper
member.summary: A class that helps with xml project serialization

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.XmlHelper.EscapeInvalidCharacters(System.String)
member.summary: Some characters create problems in xml format by being interpreted by xml parsers as content formatting tags.
member.param: The string text of the unescaped original characters
member.returns: The modified string where the characters are replaced

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.XmlHelper.UnEscapeInvalidCharacters(System.String)
member.summary: This converts the invalid characters back to the original, unescaped text
member.param: The string text of the escaped characters
member.returns: The unescaped string text

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.XmlHelper.IsValidEscapeSequence(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This tests the string in the provided text parameter starting at the specified startIndex. If the combination of characters builds one of the recognized escape sequences, then this returns true.
member.param: The string to test.
The zero based integer start index.
member.returns: A boolean that is true if the startIndex begins an escape sequence.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Serialization.XmlSerializer
member.summary: Serializes data to XML. A valid serialization map must be available for all classes being serialized. The serialization map is generally created at runtime from fields and properties marked with the . For classes that cannot be directly marked up with attributes a new map class can be created explicitly as needed.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an object into XML.
member.param: The object to serialize.
member.returns: A string containing the serialization of the given object.
